page.title: 14Uppermill 1
page.content: Uppermill is the{largest village in Saddleworth, a rural area of great beauty being largely{open moorland and {enclosed fields.}Saddleworth has a population of about 5,500 and is administered as part of{Oldham {Metropolitan Borough.}Local interests are looked after by{Saddleworth Parish {Council,}an elected body which can advise the Borough Council, but has no direct representatives on it or any power to make independent decisions. Until 1974 Saddleworth lay in the {West Riding of Yorkshire,}but is now part of{Greater Manchester County}- a subject of great discontent amongst many Saddleworth residents. Saddleworth people are fiercly protective of its{individuality}and work hard to maintain its identity as a community separate from any larger authority.
